RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 91. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE SEPTEMBER 25, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10 ,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRIKING MOON was hustled early, took command on the turn and from the three path through the stretch was much the best. STRONG ENDING settled off the pace, had a mild gain on the turn and from the seven path at the top of the stretch was up for place. CRAFTY CONQUEST was in touch and a factor on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch leveled off. JACK BEANSTALK was unhurried early and roused on the turn but from the eight path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. SUMMER RETREAT was away alertly and forced the pace on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. MOBILIZER was in range early but chased on the turn and dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Mobilizer
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Ending
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, mild gain turn, 7-path stretch, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Jack Beanstalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, roused turn, 8-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, took command turn, 3-path stretch, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Crafty Conquest
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, factor turn, 5-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Retreat
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, forced pace turn, 3-path stretch, nothing left

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Since August 25 Allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAIT N SWITCH was off slow, moved up on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch edged clear. DON'T STOP DREAMIN was hustled early and dueled on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. VOYANT was away alertly and had a slim lead on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch gave way. HALF TO RELOAD was in range and raced evenly on the turn but from the eight path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. ARTIE'S ALL IN broke poorly and showed little in a dull effort.

ENTRY.NAME: Half to Reload
ENTRY.OWNER: Ascot Stud Blake Sr Michael S Stout Mark and Stocker-Parks Rachel
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, evenly turn, 8-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Bait N Switch
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Stop Dreamin
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, dueled turn, 3-path stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Voyant
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, slim lead turn, 4-path stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Artie's All In
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke poorly, showed little, dull effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROADWAY RUCKUS set the pace, had a clear lead on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch held sway. IRIE ISLAND MAN was off the pace, had a mild gain on the far turn and from the seven path at the top of the stretch finished well. NO MORE was in touch and had a good position on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch weakened. TAYBO stalked the early leader but lost ground on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was no factor. WIN THE DRAW was in mid pack and roused on the far turn but from the 6-path at the top of the stretch had no response. UNBRIDLED INFERNO was well back and showed nothing while outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Taybo
ENTRY.OWNER: Catalano Gerard and Gnozzo Victor A
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, lost ground far turn, 4-path stretch, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: No More
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, good position far turn, 4-path stretch, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Ruckus
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead far turn, 3-pah stretch, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Irie Island Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain far turn, 7-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Win the Draw
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, roused far turn, 6-path stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Unbridled Inferno
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, showed nothing, outrun

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 7F Turf CR: 69. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRUMLIN BIRD set the pace, had a clear lead on the far turn and was kept to task through the stretch. AWILDAS TREASURE settled off the pace, moved up on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was second best. SEEDS OF GRANDEUR was unhurried early, saved ground on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for show. REIGN BY REIN stalked the early leaders and was a factor on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch faded late. SILENT BUT VIOLENT tracked the early leaders but lost ground on the far turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch was not a factor. SAVVY'S SISTER was up close but chased on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Seeds of Grandeur
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground far turn, 4-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Crumlin Bird
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead far turn, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Reign by Rein
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leaders, factor far turn, 3-path stretch, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Savvy's Sister
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close, chased far turn, 5-path stretch, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Silent But Violent
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, lost ground far turn, 6-path stretch, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Awildas Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, moved up far turn, 4-path stretch, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Since August 25 Allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sir ed Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VICTORY MARCH stalked the early leaders, had the lead on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch drew clear. MORNING THOUGHTS was unhurried early, roused from the inside on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for place. JUSTIN'S WAY was hustled early, headed on the turn and gave way. ACTION POINT settled off the pace and raced evenly on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch needed more. SEVEN IS A BREEZE was checked early, showed little and from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no impact. WILBERFORCE showed speed from the outside but chased on the turn and dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Justin's Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Leith Scott Zaniol Dean and Fournier Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, headed turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Is a Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked early, showed little, 7-path stretch, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Morning Thoughts
ENTRY.OWNER: Voyce Robyn Voyce Casey Grant and Athoe Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, roused inside turn, 4-path stretch, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Victory March
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leaders, led turn, 3-path stretch, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Action Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, evenly turn, 5-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Wilberforce
ENTRY.OWNER: Beharry Vinodh H and Ceccato Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside, chased turn, dropped back stretch

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 22200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J M R GEMMA was away alertly and set the pace, had the lead on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch prevailed. ORBITING THE SKY was unhurried early, saved ground on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch finished well. LOVE MY CHERYL forced the early pace and vied on the turn but from the three path through the stretch was outfinished. LITTLE FIRE was well back, trailed the field on the turn and was up for a share. EASY ACCESS was off slow and moved up on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch faded late. HALO STYLE tracked the early leaders and was a factor on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch had no kick. CEDAR VALLEY was in range and roused on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, trailed turn, up for share

ENTRY.NAME: Orbiting the Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground turn, 3-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Love My Cheryl
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, vied urn, 3-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Easy Access
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, moved up turn, 4-path stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: J M R Gemma
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, led turn, 4-path stretch, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Cedar Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused turn, 7-path stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Halo Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, factor turn, 6-path stretch, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 7F Turf CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BREACH OF TRUST was in touch, a factor on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch proved best. PRINCE FOR A DAY forced the early pace, dueled on the far turn and had the lead in mid stretch but failed to hold. ASHWICKEN was off the pace, had a mild gain on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for show. MIGHTY PELE set a pressured pace and had a slim lead on the far turn but gave way. NGABE was in mid pack and hustled along on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. GOGO GABRIEL was unhurried early and roused from the inside on the far turn but had no rally. GOOD SKIP INDEED was in tight early, trailed the field on the far turn and was not a factor. LADY OF THE FORT was in range but chased on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch failed to fire. AMEN TO THAT had no speed and saved ground on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Gogo Gabriel
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, roused inside far turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Breach of Trust
ENTRY.OWNER: Lee Ken Mitchell Dennis Bell Donald K and Bell Gaye
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, factor far turn, 3-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Ngabe
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, hustled along far turn, 4-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Good Skip Indeed
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight early, trailed far turn, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Ashwicken
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain far turn, 4-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Lady of the Fort
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased far turn, 5-pah stretch, failed to fire

ENTRY.NAME: Amen to That
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, saved ground far turn, 3-path stretch, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Mighty Pele
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, slim lead far turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Prince for a Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, dueled far turn, led mid stretch, failed to hold

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Special Weight Purse 21600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIAMOND HEIST tracked the early leaders, moved up on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch drew clear. EIN WAHRER SOLDAT was hustled early and a factor on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. BUSTA GROOVE showed speed from the inside and had a clear lead on the turn but was headed at the top of the stretch and gave way. TONKA WAKAN was unhurried early and roused from between foes on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch needed more. OPEECHEE was away alertly and raced evenly on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. LE GRAND GARCON was well back, trailed the field on the turn and was never in contention. GET READY SET FIRE was off the pace and showed little in a dull effort. ONCEUPONASERENADE was off slow and saved ground on the turn but had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Busta Groove
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, clear lead turn, headed top stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Onceuponaserenade
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, saved ground turn, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Ein Wahrer Soldat
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, factor turn, 4-path stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Heist
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Tonka Wakan
ENTRY.OWNER: Steer, Thomas R. and Walpole, Lance R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, roused between turn, 5-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Get Ready Set Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, showed little, dull effort

ENTRY.NAME: Le Grand Garcon
ENTRY.OWNER: Steer, Thomas R. and Walpole, Lance R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, trailed turn, never in contention

ENTRY.NAME: Opeechee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, evenly turn, 7-path stretch, no late kick
